## Overview

The Antimicrobial Resistance Surveillance Program (ARSP) of the Philippines is the national system for monitoring antimicrobial resistance patterns across the country. Coordinated by the Department of Health, ARSP provides essential data to support the Philippines' National Action Plan on Antimicrobial Resistance.

## Key Features

- **National Network**: Sentinel hospitals across major regions
- **Standardized Methods**: Uniform testing protocols and quality assurance
- **Priority Pathogens**: Focus on clinically important resistant bacteria
- **Capacity Building**: Laboratory strengthening and training programs
- **Policy Integration**: Direct links to national AMR action plans
- **Regional Collaboration**: Participation in ASEAN surveillance networks

## Use Cases in Research

- Philippine national AMR trends
- Regional variation in resistance patterns
- Healthcare infection epidemiology
- Impact of stewardship interventions
- Southeast Asian resistance comparisons
- Public health policy research

## Getting Started

Visit the [Department of Health Philippines website](https://doh.gov.ph/) to learn about the ARSP program.
